SEARCH
Package com.serial4j.core.serial

Class TerminalDevice

java.lang.Object
com.serial4j.core.serial.TerminalDevice
public final class TerminalDevice extends Object
The main entry class for the native terminal device for Serial4j api.

  • Constructor Details

    • TerminalDevice

      public TerminalDevice()

  • Method Details

    • openPort

      public void openPort(SerialPort serialPort) throws NoSuchDeviceException, NoSuchFileException, FileAlreadyOpenedException, InterruptedSystemCallException, FileIsDirectoryException, TooManyOpenedFilesException, FileTableOverflowException, NoSpaceLeftException, ReadOnlyFileSystemException, PermissionDeniedException, OperationFailedException
      Opens this device's serial port using the path from [serialPort] instance.
      Parameters:
      serialPort - the serial port instance to open.
      Throws:
      NoSuchDeviceException - if an attempt is made to open a non-device file.
      NoSuchFileException - if an attempt is made to access a file that doesn't exist.
      FileAlreadyOpenedException - if an attempt is made to open an already opened terminal device.
      InterruptedSystemCallException - if there is a process interruption while opening the port.
      FileIsDirectoryException - if an attempt is made to open a directory instead of a device.
      TooManyOpenedFilesException - if an attempt is made to open too many devices exceeding the system limit.
      FileTableOverflowException - if an attempt is made to open a device while system io is halt.
      NoSpaceLeftException - if an attempt is made to open a device while there is no space left.
      ReadOnlyFileSystemException - if an attempt is made to open a read-only device.
      PermissionDeniedException - if an unauthorized user attempts to open this device.
      OperationFailedException - if an attempt to open this port has failed for any other reasons.

    • initTermios

      public void initTermios() throws InvalidPortException, FileNotFoundException, NoAvailableTtyDevicesException
      Initializes this terminal device with the default flags and the default read timeout configuration.
      Throws:
      InvalidPortException - if an attempt is made to initialize an invalid port (non-opened/still-closed device).
      FileNotFoundException - if the device opened before has been ejected.
      NoAvailableTtyDevicesException - if the port is closed while performing the initialization operation.
